posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This build is made for level 40 PvP on medium/high magic servers with nerfed True Seeing. It works best on servers where UMD isn't necessary and weapons have large damage bonuses. Although it can also be used in level 40 PvM I wouldn't recommend it since levelling will be an absolute pain, especially on servers with a large variety of monster races.

The AB and AC are fairly mediocre for this build, but with Epic Dodge, HiPS, and up to 10 APR it can survive tough encounters fairly easily. The build's main defence is HiPS, with just +12 DEX it can self-buff to 92 Hide (96 when outside) and 72 MS (76 when outside). With +12 WIS it has 69 Spot vs Favored Enemies and 63 Spot vs non-FEs. Focusing on only one detect skill is best for this build, I chose Spot but Listen will work too.

The biggest problem with this build is the low damage, all of it comes from fighting Favored Enemies. When fighting non-FEs the build does practically no damage, which usually isn't a problem for PvP since the potential races are limited. The upside of this is that the actual weapon being used doesn't matter much. Both the unarmed and ranged damage is fairly decent against FEs, although the build will suffer -1 AB compared to dual-wielding kamas. The build below has 6 FEs, by dropping and rearranging feats it can have anywhere from 5-8 FEs.

There is an XP penalty from level 4 onwards. This can be avoided by choosing human rather than elf, but I recommend sticking with elf since without Keen Senses the high detect is pointless.
Rang25/Monk10/SD5 gives +1 AC at the cost of a Ranger feat, personally I prefer the extra feat. Rang29/Monk1/SD10 would give an extra Ranger feat, but I think the benefits of Monk9 outweigh the benefits of another feat.
The saves are pretty mediocre, by dropping epic feats you can fit in Epic Fortitude and/or Epic Will. Another possible change is swapping Toughness for Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Luck Of Heroes, or Strong Soul.
By swapping Spellcraft for Set Trap it's possible to use epic traps, however this will lower your saves against spells and prevent you from identifying any cast spells.

There are several Rang/Monk/SD builds on the forum and the archives, the closest of which is a Rang25/Monk10/SD5 by Kaliban99.

Rang23/Monk7/SD10 by Kaliban99. [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 97247.html]
A kama-wielding DEX Ranger with Epic Dodge. This class spread can be improved (and was improved later on).

Rang23/Monk12/SD5 by Ithacan. [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 67622.html]
An unarmed DEX Ranger with Epic Dodge. This is a PvP build focused on disarming opponents, it's a good concept but the build needs some tweaking.

Rang25/Monk10/SD5 by Kaliban99. [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 97547.html]
A kama-wielding DEX Ranger with Epic Dodge, it's a decent build.

Rang32/Monk6/SD2 by Demos. [the-ghost-viper-ranger-32-monk-6-shadow ... 44307.html]
A STR Ranger that uses a two-bladed sword. It would work better with kamas but I like the general concept of the build.

Rang38/Monk1/SD1 by sobebop. [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 24393.html]
A DEX Ranger that uses a longbow, this is an unfinished build.

posts.content:
Looks like a great build Yunim. 
Great use of the synergy between Ranger + SD for an outrageously high hide score 90+, I don't think anything other than vanilla True Seeing is going to spot you, although happy to be proven wrong :)
